result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven G. Spencer

records.addlTxt: 01:51 PM Defendant Steven G. Spencer in court with attorney John Zich, special appearance.  Defendant Steven G. Spencer in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven G. Spencer appeared by video means with Attorney.  All parties via zoom.  Def. is okay with Atty Zich to represent him.  Information Filed.  Atty Zich has copy of complaint waives reading and enters Not Guilty plea. Court receives Not Guilty plea. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

02:32 PM Defendant Steven G. Spencer in court with attorney John Zich, special appearance.  Defendant Steven G. Spencer in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven G. Spencer appeared by video means with Attorney. Atty Zich has copy of information, waives reading, reserve all rights and enters Not Guilty plea. Def. has not spoke to Atty Restemayer.  Court will adjourn so def. can talk to his Atty.  Arraignment scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:09 PM Defendant Steven G. Spencer in court, in custody. Attorney Fehrenbach appears in court for defendant. Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and reviews. Attorney Fehrenbach agrees to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and goes over waiver of rights for preliminary hearing. Defendant waives right for a preliminary hearing. Court accepts the waiver of preliminary hearing in case. Court finds probable cause for waiver and binds over. Attorney Gebert makes statement and requests a later date for an arraignment.  An arraignment has been scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 1:30pm. Attorney Gebert has no questions for the court. Attorney Fehrenbach has no questions for the court. Court is adjourned.  Arraignment scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:52 PM Defendant Steven G. Spencer in court with attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer, special appearance by Atty John Zich, via zoom.  Defendant Steven G. Spencer in custody, via zoom.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven G. Spencer appeared by video means with Attorney.  Atty Zich has copy of complaint, waives reading, reserve rights and request timely p.h. Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:14 PM Defendant Steven G. Spencer in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via Zoom.  Steven G. Spencer appeared by Zoom means. All parties via Zoom. Court calls case and reviews. Court reviews the complaint with the defendant, advised of charges and penalties. Def. was not given a copy of the complaint, court advised defendant he will receive a copy. Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Attorney Gebert makes statement and a recommendation of a cash bond of $10,000 with conditions of no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, and no contact with S.J.S. Def. responds to DA. Court makes ruling. Court orders a $10,000 cash bond with conditions of no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, and no contact with S.J.S. Adjourned initial appearance is scheduled for 4/18/22 at 1:30pm. Court is adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
